channel.title: [tut] css
channel.description:
[center][size=15pt]MORE TO COME![/size] How I think of CSS: A longer way of HTML :P[/center] [b]Set backround Color:[/b] -Way to simple ;D [code] [/code] All you have to do is change the aqua to what color you want the backround :) [b]Set backround Image:[/b] [code]
Moparisthebest.com Tutorial :)
[/code] Change the url to whatever you want the backround image to be.. Also to add in text, just start typing either at the end of script, or where I did. [b]Indenting Text:[/b] [code]

Moparisthebest.com Tutorial

[/code] keep this all the same, but you can change to color to whatever you want.. If you want to type you have to type where I did. :) [b]Border:[/b] [code]

Moparisthebest.com Tutorial
-Cabby

[/code] Ok, pretty simple.. But if you dont want a solid border, I will post a list right below this of what you can have.. But when you change it you have to change where it says "p.solid {border-style: solid}" you would change the solid to something from the list.. Also, where it says "

" You would change the solid to the same thing you did for the first one.. THE LIST [code] p.double {border-style: double} p.groove {border-style: groove} p.ridge {border-style: ridge} p.inset {border-style: inset} p.outset {border-style: outset} p.dotted {border-style: dotted} p.dashed {border-style: dashed} [/code] [b]Hyperlink Styles:[/b] [code] Move your mouse over the links to see the styles. MOPARISTHEBEST.COM TUTORIAL

COLOR

FONT SIZE

BG COLOR

FONT FAMILY

UNDERSCORE

[/code] To change what styles the links do, go to the top of code and change that stuff to fit you needs. :rolleyes:

item.title: [tut] css

item.description:
@error.login wrote:

Fatal Desire:

So does this all go in style.css?

yes then on your html document add this in between the head tags

<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style.css" />

item.title: [tut] css
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Never put css directly into a webpage. If you want to use conditional comments (the only reason I can think of to use header css), use @import. And put semicolons after your lines. And space out those curly brackets…

p {
  font-family:Tahoma, Verdana, Serif;
}

Read full topic

-Alexia

item.title: [tut] css
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

[center][size=15pt]MORE TO COME![/size]
How I think of CSS: A longer way of HTML :P[/center]

Set backround Color: -Way to simple ;D

<style type="text/css">
body {background-color: aqua}

</style>

All you have to do is change the aqua to what color you want the backround

Set backround Image:

<style type="text/css">
body 
{
background-image:
url('http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/mopar.gif')
}
</style>

<body>
<center><font color="yellow">Moparisthebest.com Tutorial :)</font></center>
</body>

Change the url to whatever you want the backround image to be…
Also to add in text, just start typing either at the end of script, or where I did.

Indenting Text:

<style type="text/css">
p {text-indent: 1cm}
</style>


<body>
<p>
<center><font color="Aqua"> Moparisthebest.com Tutorial </font></center>
</P>
</body>

keep this all the same, but you can change to color to whatever you want…
If you want to type you have to type where I did.

Border:

<style type="text/css">
p.solid {border-style: solid}


</style>

<body>
<p class="solid">Moparisthebest.com Tutorial     <br> -Cabby</p>
</body>

Ok, pretty simple… But if you dont want a solid border, I will post a list right below this of what you can have…
But when you change it you have to change where it says “p.solid {border-style: solid}” you would change the solid to something from the list…
Also, where it says “

” You would change the solid to the same thing you did for the first one…
THE LIST

p.double {border-style: double}
p.groove {border-style: groove}
p.ridge {border-style: ridge}
p.inset {border-style: inset}
p.outset {border-style: outset}
p.dotted {border-style: dotted}
p.dashed {border-style: dashed}

Hyperlink Styles:

<html>
<head>
<style type="text/css">
a.one:link {color: #ff0000}
a.one:visited {color: #0000ff}
a.one:hover {color: #ffcc00}

a.two:link {color: #ff0000}
a.two:visited {color: #0000ff}
a.two:hover {font-size: 150%}

a.three:link {color: #ff0000}
a.three:visited {color: #0000ff}
a.three:hover {background: #66ff66}

a.four:link {color: #ff0000}
a.four:visited {color: #0000ff}
a.four:hover {font-family: monospace}

a.five:link {color: #ff0000; text-decoration: none}
a.five:visited {color: #0000ff; text-decoration: none}
a.five:hover {text-decoration: underline}
</style>
</head>

<body>
<b> Move your mouse over the links to see the styles. MOPARISTHEBEST.COM TUTORIAL</b>

<p><b><a class="one" href="http://www.moparisthebest.com" target="_blank">COLOR</a></b></p>
<p><b><a class="two" href="http://www.moparisthebest.com" target="_blank">FONT SIZE</a></b></p>
<p><b><a class="three" href="http://www.moparisthebest.com" target="_blank">BG COLOR</a></b></p>
<p><b><a class="four" href="http://www.moparisthebest.com" target="_blank">FONT FAMILY</a></b></p>
<p><b><a class="five" href="http://www.moparisthebest.com" target="_blank">UNDERSCORE</a></b></p>
</body>

</html>

To change what styles the links do, go to the top of code and change that stuff to fit you needs. :rolleyes:

Read full topic
